page.title: 15 The Valley School.
page.content: The Valley School,in Oakamoor, was built in 1891.It has a hall,three class rooms,a kitcken,two cloakrooms with toilet blocks,and large playing fields. Children start school here when they are 4 and a half years old and leave when they are 11 years old,when they go to Cheadle or Painsley High Schools. The Valley School is run by two staff, Mrs Slade,the head teacher, and Mrs Ratcliff,with help from Mrs Whitingham and all the usual subjects are taught. There are 42 pupils in Valley at the present and school dinners are cooked there for both Valley and Faber School at Cotton,with which school joint games activities have taken place over many years. There is a play school group for the pre-school age children of the area,in a room by the Free Church,run by Mrs. Clewes.
